result.execSummary:
The defendant David Anton Heritsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes:
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample on 8-30-16.
Pay DNA surcharge.

No contact with victims, their family or properties.
No posting on social media regarding victims or their business.
No consumption of alcohol or any illegal substances.
May not be in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

Any counseling, assessments and follow through as recommended by agent.
Attorney fees to be paid from money on deposit, any balance remaining to continue being paid as previously ordered directly to the Marinette County Clerk of Courts.

timeConds.notes:
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
No good time.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
